Among Us is less of a game and more of a psychological experiment. Youâ€™ll laugh, accuse your friends, defend your innocence with Oscar-worthy performances, and then immediately stab them in the back when the lights go out. Among Us is a simple but super fun social deduction game thatâ€™s all about trust, lying, and calling your friends â€œsus.â€ Every match feels different because you never know who the Impostor is or what crazy accusations people will make. The tasks are easy, the maps are varied, and the chaos in meetings is hilarious. Itâ€™s best with friends, but still entertaining with random players. Some people leave early, and games can be quick, but the fun moments make up for it. Overall, itâ€™s a great, addictive multiplayer game thatâ€™s perfect for quick sessions.

A modern classic for party gaming.

Among Us is a fun and engaging party game with a great premise built around teamwork and deception. The core idea of identifying impostors keeps each round exciting. However, it can be frustrating to get singled out and ejected despite being an innocent crew member. Still, the chaotic unpredictability is part of its charm, making it an enjoyable game overall.

Steam Review for "Among Us"
Rating: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜†

"Among Us" is a delightful blend of deception, teamwork, and a touch of chaos that has taken the gaming world by storm! Whether you're a seasoned player or just diving in, this game promises endless fun with friends and strangers alike.

Engaging Gameplay
The core mechanics are straightforward yet endlessly engaging. As Crewmates, your mission is to complete tasks around the spaceship while keeping an eye out for the Impostor. The Impostor, on the other hand, must deceive and eliminate without being caught. The thrill of trying to figure out whoâ€™s lying is what makes "Among Us" so addictive.

Tips for New Players
Stick Together: As a Crewmate, team up with others to complete tasks. There's safety in numbers!
Mind Your Tasks: Spread your tasks around the map so youâ€™re not stuck in one area. Familiarize yourself with task locations to be more effective.
Communicate Clearly: Use the chat wisely during meetings. State where you were, what you saw, and stick to facts to avoid suspicion.
Embrace the Sabotage: If youâ€™re playing as the Impostor, use sabotage strategically! Cut off lights or reactor access to create confusion.
Fun Strategies
Create a Safe Space: As a Crewmate, establish a "safe zone" with trusted players where you can discuss findings without fear of getting picked off.
Feign Task Completion: If you're an Impostor, make sure to pretend you're doing tasks. Faking a task can throw off Crewmates when they try to gather info during discussions.
Observe Behavior Patterns: Watch how players react during discussions. A guilty player may get defensive or overly eager to blame othersâ€”these could be telltale signs!
Replay Value
The variations in gameplay keep things fresh. With customizable roles, different maps, and ever-changing player dynamics, no two matches are the same. Youâ€™ll find yourself coming back for more of those heart-pounding moments when fingers are pointed and accusations fly.

Wholesome Community
One of the best aspects of "Among Us" is the community. Most players join with the intention of having fun, which fosters a light-hearted atmosphere. Plus, sharing laughs and inside jokes with friends adds an extra layer of enjoyment!

Final Thoughts
If youâ€™re searching for a social deduction game that mixes laughter, suspense, and the thrill of â€œwho-done-it,â€ look no further than "Among Us." Itâ€™s a perfect game for parties, casual hangouts, or even just a quick session to unwind. Grab some friends, navigate the lies, and see if you can outsmart each other in this delightful game of trust... or betrayal!

Would I recommend it? Absolutely! Just remember: trust no one!

negative.review:
To preface: I love this game. It's unique and has a dedicated community and new features still rolling out. BUT the disconnect issues are awful. I get kicked from games or banned from rooms that I wasn't actually banned from. Friends and I have had to make totally new lobbies because half of us have been "banned" and aren't able to rejoin. And I just got my account suspended from game play for 2 hours due to one of these disconnects. It said I "intentionally disconnected" which isn't true.

I'm surprised such a popular game has so many crash issues that actively impact game play, community play, and personal accounts. Please fix! Otherwise I really love this game! It's just so frustrating to try to play with these issues.

[h1]The More, The Worse[/h1]

[b]Among Us[/b]. You know it, you love it. Or do you? The more they added to this game, the less fun it became to play. The simplistic nature of the older versions was what was so charming about it. The newer roles actually make the game less fun. This game is stuck in a rare limbo where adding more content actively makes it worse...hide and seek is good, though.

On top of that, the playerbase and culture you remember has completely changed, the heights of COVID, which I have great memories of, may never be replicated again.

Overall, game can be fun still with the right people with classic rules. I just think it's about time Innersloth make something new rather than keep updating a game where its peak period can never be replicated.

[h1]The More, The Worse[/h1]

[b]Among Us[/b]. You know it, you love it. Or do you? The more they added to this game, the less fun it became to play. The simplistic nature of the older versions was what was so charming about it. The newer roles actually make the game less fun. This game is stuck in a rare limbo where adding more content actively makes it worse...hide and seek is good, though.

On top of that, the playerbase and culture you remember has completely changed, the heights of COVID, which I have great memories of, may never be replicated again.

Overall, game can be fun still with the right people with classic rules. I just think it's about time Innersloth make something new rather than keep updating a game where its peak period can never be replicated.

In recent years, Among Us has become terrible. Everything that made it fun to play has been more or less removed. The new classes are boring, the hide and seek game mode is borderline impossible to enjoy, and the new classes make the game completely unbalanced.

I used to be able to pick up any device in my house and hand it to anyone and say "let's play Among Us" and they would know how to set everything up without any assistance, could join my game, and would not need to have someone explain every stupid role to them. 

Now it's impossible to join your friends with any degree of accuracy or ease due to the bullcrap new chat system and hurdles the people making this game have put in place, such as making an account to join online games. Local never works, so the game is useless without an account. On top of this, when trying to create an account on mobile, much of the time you just can't.
